newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Diamond Deng Xiaoping watch is latest souvenir.
newsitem.headline: Diamond Deng Xiaoping watch is latest souvenir.

text.p: China's entrepreneurs are showing they've picked up a trick or two from Hong Kong's capitalists.

Diamond-encrusted watches bearing the profile of China's 92-year-old paramount leader Deng Xiaoping went on sale on Monday, the latest souvenirs touted to celebrate Hong Kong's return to China's fold on July 1 this year.
The manufacturer? The government in communist China's southern province of Guangdong.
The price? HK$18,500 (US$2,387) for the men's model and HK$16,500 (US$2,129) for the ladies' version. Only 4,000 timepieces will be released.
The Beijing-funded Wen Wei Po newspaper, which faithfully reflects the Chinese Communist Party's views in Hong Kong, splashed the watches in a colour front-page advertisement.
"Engrave historic moments on the mind. Preserve the grace of a great man," the advertisement said.
The watches were designed by Deng's disabled son, Deng Pufang, and proceeds would go to a foundation for the handicapped in China, the advertisement said.
Deng's reform policies are regarded as responsible for transforming China into one of the fastest growing economies.
